pageContext.description: Cutting edge part of celt; edge blunt and chipped; broken section shows top of socket, retaining wooden haft.
pageContext.surface: Mainly smooth with some pits and encrustment.
pageContext.associations: Part of large hoard; see card for first socketed celt.
pageContext.publications: Arch. Journ. XXX, 279,Jessup, Arch of Kent, 107,Evans,Journ. Anhtop. Inst. III, 230.
pageContext.site: England,Kent,Saltwood,Haynes Wood, in line of railway cutting, 6 ft. below surface, lying on stratum of sand, c. 25 yards NE by N of summit of hill. Found June 4, 1872
pageContext.toSearch: Saltwood, Hythe, Hythe, Kent Ct21, UK
